title: Drawing, "Design for a Gas Lamp and Candelabrum", ca. 1855
medium: Brush and watercolor, gouache, pen and blue ink over graphite on tracing paper
inscribed:
Lower left: Candelabre porcel: de Chine et Bronze/ a 20 bougies et Lampe au milieu.
Lower center: N: 66.
Lower right: Chantieur 230.
Stamped above: 83
creditline: Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund
description: This drawing depicts a candelabrum and gas lamp consisting of a tall-necked porcelain vase in a floral design. The vase is mounted on a gilt-bronze tri-footed base, with putti flanking a coat-of-arms surmounting a female mask. Twenty candle arms encircle the gas lamp.

exhibitions.title: House Proud: 19th Century Watercolor Interiors from the Thaw Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Gas Lamp and Candelabrum", ca. 1855.
ca. 1855. Brush and watercolor, gouache, pen and blue ink over graphite on tracing paper. Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund. 1953-206-4.
